explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Not classified because it "may burn but does not ignite readily (HSDB, 2005)"

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category by the statement of may burn but does not ignite readily (HSDB (2005)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Since there is a data of water solubles, it carried out the outside of Category for not being water reactive.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though organic compounds containing oxygen chemically bonded to phosphorus (but not fluorine and chlorine).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat ENDPOINT: LD50 VALUE: 100-300mg/kg REFERENCE SOURCE: ACGIH (2001)
SPECIES: Rat ENDPOINT: LD50 VALUE: 107-304mg/kg (male), 65-275mg/kg (female) REFERENCE SOURCE: PATTY (5th, 2001)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from the description of rabbit LD50: male 820m/kg, female 994mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and 800 - 1000 mg/kg (ACGIH (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There is no data, and it cannot be classified. (generation of vapor can be disregarded in room temperatures.)

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: There is no data and it cannot classify. (There is a data of mouse and hamster LC50 >0.49mg/L/4H (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and Category 3 and 4 can be assumed. )

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as out of Category from the statement of having no stimulativeness on the examination with rabbits (ACGIH (2001)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as the outside of Category from the statement of having no stimulativeness (ACGIH (2001)) by the examination of the rabbit.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: Classified as uncategorizable because of no data. Skin sensitization: Classified as out of category because the guinea pig test using a pure product came negative. (A test using an end-use product can result positive.)

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Because of the reports indicating negative results in the dominant lethal test in mice (ACGIH (2001)), the mouse micronucleus test (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and in the in vitro test (the Ames test, sister chromatid exchange test) (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)). So the substance was regarded as outside the categories.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is the description that carcinogenicity was not observed in mouse and dog test (PATTY (5th, 2001)). And it was set as the outside of Category from being classified into A4 according to ACGIH.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: The fetotoxity and teratogenicity were not observed but maternal toxicity (feed consumption and weight reduction) was observed (ACGIH(2001)) in the pregnant animals oral administration test of rat and rabbit, maternal toxicity, ferotoxity and teratogenicity was not observed in the pragnant animals oral administration test of rat (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and reproductive toxicity was not observed in three generation test of rat (inhalation exposure) (ACGIH(2001)). Based on the above, it was put on the outside of category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Suppression of the central nervous system, such as headaches, dizziness, convulsions and respiratory failure are observed, and other effects on the nervous system, such as constriction of the pupils, arrhythmia and muscle spasms, are observed as acute toxicity symptoms in humans (EHC 63 (1986), ICSC (1993), HSDB (2005)). Moreover, there is the report of suppression of cholinesterase activity in sera, erythrocytes and the brain within the guidance values for Category 1 in the single-dose study (PATTY (5th, 2001)). So the substance was classified as Category 1 (nervous system).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since in the repeted oral or inhalation administration with rat, inhibition in cholinesterase activities was observed within the guidance value of Category 1(ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)), and as a human chronic toxicity symptoms, because of the description of headaches, weakness, failure of memory, a sleep disturbances, decreased appetite, disorientation, and hand and foot trembling etc (HSDB (2005)). Based on these results it was classified into Category 1 (nervous system) .

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50= 0.75ppb of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and bioaccumulative (log Kow=5.48 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
